required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Study to Evaluate B4T2-001 CAR T Cells in the Treatment of Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A FIH, Single Arm, Open Label Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Preliminary Antitumor Activity of Autologous CAR T Cells Targeting BT-001 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: This is a first in human (FIH), open-label, dose escalation and expansion study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics, and antitumor activity of B4T2-001 Autologous CAR T cells in subjects with advanced solid tumors including but not limited to advanced gastric or gastroesophageal junction (GEJ) adenocarcinoma, advanced pancreatic cancer, advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), colorectal cancers (CRC) and metastatic breast cancer that tests positive for BT-001 target antigen according to Immunohistochemistry (IHC).

detailed_description.textblock: This is an open-label dose escalation and dose expansion study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics, and antitumor activity of B4T2-001 Autologous CAR T cells in subjects with BT-001 expressing advanced solid tumors. Patients who meet the eligibility criteria will receive B4T2-001 CAR T infusion after lymphodepletion. The lymphodepleting chemotherapy is administered on days -5, -4, and -3 before CAR T infusion using cyclophosphamide 300mg/m2 once daily and fludarabine 30mg/m2 once daily for 3 consecutive days. Doses may be adjusted for renal and/or hepatic insufficiency, or other comorbidities. The study is designed to include the following sequential steps: patient screening, pre-treatment, treatment and follow up for up to 2 years.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of serious adverse events (SAEs), incidence and severity of adverse events (AEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Minimum 2 years after B4T2-001 CAR T infusion
primary_outcome.description: Safety and tolerability of B4T2-001 CAR T cells

primary_outcome.measure: To determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) and recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D) of B4T2-001 CAR T cells
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 years after B4T2-001 CAR T infusion
primary_outcome.description: The MTD will be determined based on the occurrence of the Dose-Limiting Toxicities (DLTs) according to the accelerated titration design and 3+3 dose escalation design. RP2D will be defined based on MTD, safety, PK, and preliminary efficacy data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Area Under Curve (AUC) with immunoanalytical method
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood sampling for PK will be performed at planned time points till the end of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): maximum concentration (Cmax) with immunoanalytical method
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood sampling for PK will be performed at planned time points till the end of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Time to Cmax (Tmax) with immunoanalytical method
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood sampling for PK will be performed at planned time points till the end of the study
Minimum 2 years after B4T2-001 CAR T infusion
secondary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as the proportion of subjects who achieve complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) after treatment via B4T2-001 CAR T cell infusion, and the objective tumor response rate will be calculated for patients with measurable disease per RECIST 1.1 only

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Minimum 2 years after B4T2-001 CAR T infusion
secondary_outcome.description: DOR is defined as the time from the first documentation of remission (PR or better) to the first documented disease progression evidence (according to RECIST 1.1) of the responders (who achieve PR or better response)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Minimum 2 years after B4T2-001 CAR T infusion
secondary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the time from the date of first infusion of the B4T2-001 to the first documented disease progression (according to RECIST 1.1) or death (due to any cause), whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Minimum 2 years after B4T2-001 CAR T infusion
secondary_outcome.description: OS is defined as the time from the date of first infusion of B4T2-001 CAR T to death of the subject

other_outcome.measure: Blood cytokine levels include interleukin 6 (IL-6), IL-2, IL-4, IL-8, IL-10, TNF-α, and INF-γ with ELISA or equivalent method
other_outcome.time_frame: Blood sampling for cytokine measurement will be performed at planned time points till 90 days after B4T2-001 CAR T infusion
other_outcome.description: Concentration and kinetics of multiple blood cytokines including (IL-6), IL-2, IL-4, IL-8, IL-10, TNF-α, and INF-γ using ELISA or equivalent before and after CAR T infusion and will be evaluated according to actual blood sampling time points

other_outcome.time_frame: Minimum 2 years after B4T2-001 CAR T infusion
other_outcome.description: Explore and evaluate histology before and after CAR T infusion for expression of BT-001 antigen on the tumor by IHC with histologist scoring system to evaluate the score intensity. H score (0-300) will be calculated

other_outcome.time_frame: Minimum 2 years after B4T2-001 CAR T infusion
other_outcome.description: Explore and evaluate histology before and after CAR T infusion for expression of BT-001 antigen on the tumor by IHC with histologist scoring system to evaluate the score intensity. Overall IHC Score (0-4) will be calculated

other_outcome.measure: The percentage of positive stained tumor.
other_outcome.time_frame: Minimum 2 years after B4T2-001 CAR T infusion
other_outcome.description: Explore and evaluate histology before and after CAR T infusion for expression of BT-001 antigen on the tumor

arm_group.description: Single Arm and Open Label study consisting of dose escalation study design followed by dose expansion phase at determined MTD. Treatment follows a lymphodepleting chemotherapy regimen

intervention.description: Each subject will receive infusion with B4T2-001 autologous CAR T Cells
